channel.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
channel.description:
Some abilities are critical for removing game breaking strategies. However most of them are only available for the Unseen. I propose that each cult class has an ultimate that can only be used once per class (so if a seeker uses his ult then no other seekers can)
Seeker:
> Day Ability: Mind Wraith - Immediately learn target player's class and get a copy of their logs (1 use)
Invoker:
> Day Ability: Weaken - If the Cult Leader attempts to erraticate target player then the erraticate cannot fail on them. (1 use)
Ritualist:
> Day Ability: Shroud - If target player dies today or tommorow they will appear as the class of your choice (1 use)
Apostle:
> Passive: Astral - Until an ultimate is used your ability's do not count as visiting

item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Shrimpy:

Defile and Frame do not fit this definition at all. They don’t use the chat system.

Defile and frame disrupt communication by making others think someone is a certain class when they actually aren’t.

NuclearBurrito:

Special - None of the above

Special is also several of the above. Otherwise prince wouldn’t fit since it’s offensive, killer, support, and social.

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
I still find it confusing how you don’t consider a chilled person to be under the influence of an effect. But I don’t think we will ever agree anyway since I still consider social to mean related to chat.

Read full topic

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Yes. An effect is something that either impacts a different effect or a status. Therefor in order to be an effect it needs to be connected to statuses in some way. Thus barrier is an effect because it block effects such as conversion. We know conversion is an effect because it changes a status (class). If barrier did not stop anything that could either change a status or something that could impact something ELSE from changing a status then it would not be an effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Your definition of “effect” is self-referential lol, it includes the word “effect” in its own definition … could you resolve that?

Read full topic

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Social - Any action that gives someone else feedback but does not apply any effects*

So what would you classify all the chat abilities as? Telepathy, Conduit, Link Minds, Trollbox, Icy Touch, and Distract?

Read full topic

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I like to seperate things into 3 category’s:

Status - An object or passive (Your class, Being dead, Being poisoned/bleeding)
Effect - A one time event that can change a status or effect (Redirection, Occupy, Prevention, Attack, Conversion ect.)
Feedback - A message that informs you of a Status, Effect or Feedback (Target is unseen, You were attacked but immune, ect.)

Killer - Any effect that applies the dead status
Offensive - Any action that applies a negative effect or status or remove a positive
Support - Any action that appliest a positive effect or status or remove a negative one
Investigative - Any action that gives you feedback but does not apply any effects
Social - Any action that gives someone else feedback but does not apply any effects*
Special - None of the above

*voting is neither a status, effect or feedback and is thus not covered by these definitions nor am I attempting to here.

Read full topic

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
TLDR: Social is the inverse of Investigative. Defile and Drug both qualify.

Read full topic

item.title: Cult Ultimates (ToL)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Basically. Ask the question of if the ability would still impact anything if the player targeted submitted his action and then went AFK without doing anything else would the effect matter? If the answer is no then it’s usually social.

That isn’t a hard clad rule or anything as there can be social ability’s where the answer is yes (Trollbox, Frame, ect) but there it’s either because it’s effect isn’t on the target or because it has additional non-social effects (such as intrigue, which has an investigative effect).

If the person being effected by the ability is you and only you and the answer to the “Would this still matter if I was AKF” question is no then it’s investigative.

Read full topic
